decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and sacrifice synergies, leveraging cards like Witch's Oven and Claim the Firstborn. By utilizing creatures like Serrated Scorpion and Mayhem Devil, along with the companion Obosh, the Preypiercer, the deck aims to deal consistent damage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Judith, the Scourge Diva and Gutterbones adds further synergy and flexibility to the deck's strategy, making it a powerful and fast-paced Aggro deck in the Rakdos archetype.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive red creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Torbran and Embercleave, it aims to maximize damage output and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The low-cost creatures like Fervent Champion and Scorch Spitter help to establish early board presence, while cards like Light Up the Stage and Experimental Frenzy provide card advantage and continuous pressure. The goal is to maintain a fast pace of play and force the opponent to react defensively, ultimately securing a quick victory through relentless aggression.

This deck utilizes Fires of Invention to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful spells for control purposes. By playing cards like Shark Typhoon and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents for extra triggers. With a mixture of removal, card draw, and powerful threats like Agent of Treachery, this deck seeks to outvalue and outpace the opponent for victory.

The main focus of this aggressive red deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost creatures and efficient direct damage spells. The deck aims to maintain a fast pace and apply pressure early on, utilizing cards like Tin Street Dodger and Scorch Spitter to keep up the aggression. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion provides an additional boost to damage output. With a focus on board presence and burn spells like Light Up the Stage, the deck aims to swiftly defeat the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay using cards with cycling abilities to quickly draw through the deck and find key combo pieces. The main win condition is to cycle through the deck, build up a large number of cycling cards, and then finish off the opponent with a massive Zenith Flare. By utilizing Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, players can continuously recur cycling cards from the graveyard to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient cycling creatures and burn damage from Zenith Flare.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. The deck also includes a companion in Yorion, Sky Nomad to provide additional value through blinking permanents. The deck utilizes a combination of card draw, token generation, and removal spells to control the board and ultimately win the game through the value generated by Fires of Invention and powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery. The deck is designed to outvalue and outpace opponents in a 1 vs 1 Standard format.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with counterspells and removal such as Mystical Dispute and Deafening Clarion. The deck includes several high-impact creatures like Sphinx of Foresight, Cavalier of Flame, and Kenrith, the Returned King, to apply pressure on the opponent. Additionally, cards like Shark Typhoon and Brazen Borrower provide versatility and options for card advantage or tempo plays. Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way offer card advantage and disruption against opponents.

The primary strategy of this deck revolves around utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells each turn without tapping mana. This allows the player to establish control over the board by playing powerful cards like Agent of Treachery and Elspeth Conquers Death while also generating card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also includes a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, to enable additional value by blinking permanents. Overall, the deck aims to stall the game with board wipes like Shatter the Sky and eventually win through card advantage and powerful threats.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to utilize the synergy between sacrificing creatures with cards like Witch's Oven and Claim the Firstborn to trigger effects from Mayhem Devil and Judith, the Scourge Diva. Additionally, the deck aims to create a steady stream of creatures with Whisper Squad and Gutterbones, while dealing incremental damage with Serrated Scorpion and Footlight Fiend. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion adds an extra layer of damage output to the deck, making it a fast and aggressive force to be reckoned with in Standard 1 vs 1 matches.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for incremental advantage, using cards like Witch's Oven, Claim the Firstborn, and Priest of Forgotten Gods to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes the graveyard with cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Call of the Death-Dweller to bring back key creatures and maintain pressure on the opponent. Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger provides additional value with its escape ability, while Cauldron Familiar and Gutterbones offer recurring threats to chip away at the opponent's life total.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon to generate value and card advantage. The deck includes a mix of counter spells, removal, and card draw to maintain control of the board while slowly building up a strong presence. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides additional value and life gain, while Expansion / Explosion can be used as a finisher or to draw additional cards. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a grinding matchup.

This deck focuses on using low-cost, evasive creatures like Brineborn Cutthroat and Sea-Dasher Octopus to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. It also utilizes counterspells like Quench, Mystical Dispute, and Neutralize to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own threats. With the addition of flexible cards like Brazen Borrower and Aether Gust, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and maintain board presence while steadily chipping away at the opponent's life total.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with sweepers like Shatter the Sky and removal spells like Elspeth Conquers Death. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by recurring threats with Yorion, Sky Nomad and stealing their key permanents with Agent of Treachery. The deck also includes card draw engines like Narset, Parter of Veils and Omen of the Sea to maintain card advantage and find the necessary pieces to control the game.

The key concept of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy using Fires of Invention to play spells for free. The deck utilizes a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers to maintain control of the game. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a companion to provide additional value and card advantage. The deck focuses on generating card advantage and overwhelming the opponent with threats like Shark Typhoon, Agent of Treachery, and Mythos of Illuna. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent in the long game.

The deck focuses on leveraging the cycling ability of its cards to quickly cycle through the deck, generate card advantage, and deal damage to the opponent with cards like Zenith Flare and Drannith Stinger. The creatures in the deck provide early pressure and can be cycled away if needed. The deck aims to maintain a high level of aggression and efficiency by constantly cycling through its cards to find the necessary resources to win the game.
